summary: On 23 January, 2015 the Supreme Court of India heard the appeal of Pathubha Govindji Rathod and Anr against the conviction of them by the High Court of Gujarat for the murder of Satish Jotva in 2003. On the night of 7th and 8th of March 2003, four members of the same family namely Natha Nagabhai, Hamir Nagabhai, Punjabhai Bhimshibhai and Jagmal Jivabhai were shot at by Pathubha Govindji Rathod and 18 others in Mangrol village of Junagarh district. Five accused have been convicted and sentenced to five years' imprisonment by a sessions court in a 2004 assault case and seven years' imprisonment by a trial court in a 2005 assault case.

summary: The Supreme Court of India has upheld the Uttarakhand government's decision to allow Gujarat Ambuja Exports Ltd and Anr to set up a joint venture in the state. The Uttarakhand High Court has ruled in favour of the Uttarakhand Agricultural Marketing (Development and Regulation) Act, 2011 and upheld the validity of the same. The appellants were served a notice by the Mandi Samiti, Kiccha, on the basis of which they were required to pay Mandi fee or development cess on agricultural produce brought into the market area for the purpose of manufacturing.
